div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, [October 8, 1897]
div1.p:
I am glad you
are coming right
through. I would
have advised the
night train as the
day trip is rather
long. The trip on
the ferry around
N. Y. is very interesting
We shall be at
the station to meet
you. I think it
would be much
better for you to
stay over night
at our house
We can all be
comfortable.

Uncle Tom is
expected at Windsor
tomorrow morning.

I do not know
how long he is going to
stay.

I am anxious to hear about
your sight seeing.

On the train you can
usually get buffet meals
at any time. There is a
table dehote dinner served on
the ferry boat, but it is at
three o'clock which is
barbarous and besides it
compels you to miss the
the interesting scenery from
the deck.
